summary: This is a Law360 New York newsletter from October 7, 2021, containing summaries of various legal news articles. The primary Epstein-related content is a brief update on the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, noting the judge floated the idea of having jurors sit during the holiday season. The rest of the newsletter covers unrelated legal news.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in an article update about her sex-trafficking trial, where the judge considered having jurors sit during the holiday season.

persons.name: Jenny Rivera
persons.context: Mentioned as the lone New York state judge flouting the chief judge's COVID-19 vaccination mandate, provoking ire from court employee unions.

persons.name: Jed Rakoff
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated article about dismissing a lawsuit brought by an NBA agent over a gift to a player.

persons.name: Neil Cole
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated securities article about his fraud trial where a star witness pointed the finger at him.

persons.name: Rachael Rollins
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated article as President Biden's pick for U.S. attorney in Massachusetts, facing GOP opposition.

persons.name: Lucy H. Koh
persons.role: U.S. District Judge / Ninth Circuit Nominee
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated article about defending her COVID-19 ruling during her Ninth Circuit nomination hearing.

persons.name: Michael Sussmann
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated article about seeking clarity on a DOJ indictment accusing him of lying to the FBI.

persons.name: Mitchell Robinson
persons.context: Mentioned in an unrelated article about a lawsuit involving an NBA agent's gift.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Holiday Schedule Considered
events.description: A Manhattan federal judge floated the idea of having the jury in Ghislaine Maxwell's sex-trafficking trial sit between Christmas and New Year's Day.

keyFacts: The document is a Law360 newsletter from October 7, 2021, with only a brief mention of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The Maxwell trial update indicates the judge was considering an unusual holiday schedule for the jury.
The vast majority of the newsletter content is unrelated to the Epstein case, covering other legal news in New York.
The document shows the Maxwell trial was ongoing and generating news updates in late 2021.
